alert.note: Alert for Central Chaffee County Below 9000 Ft; Western Chaffee County Between 9000 and 11000 Ft; Western Mosquito Range, East Chaffee County above 9000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 8:20PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Chaffee County through 845 PM MDT... At 820 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Nathrop, or 14 miles north of Poncha Pass, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Chaffee County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Chaffee County Below 9000 Ft; Western Chaffee County Between 9000 and 11000 Ft; Western Mosquito Range, East Chaffee County above 9000Ft
